intro: Clusia blattophila, commonly known as the golden trumpet plant, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Clusiaceae family, also known as the genus genus family, and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine, and the plant is also popular as an ornamental due to its vibrant foliage and flowers. Clusia blattophila is a fast-growing species that can reach heights of up to 6 meters in ideal conditions.
